alert.note: Alert for Eastern King William; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western King and Queen and central King William Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Manquin, or near King William, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... King William, Aylett, Manquin, Central Garage, Rumford, Lanesville, Palls, Turpin, Upshaw, Walkerton, Rose Garden and Pollards Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King William; Western King William; Western King and Queen
